overview:
Michael Edell is the CEO of Interneer. He was previously at Groundwork Equity a company helping the growth of technology companies by providing strategic planning, execution and access to investment capital. Michael is a Founder and Managing Partner of GroundWork Equity, LLC., founded in early 2006. He is responsible for the firm’s strategic planning and investment policies and is also involved with all our portfolio companies, providing corporate growth and development leadership which has lead to high-value exit strategies.

Michael is also the founder of Warehouse Auction Centers, Inc., a privately held online e-commerce site for collectible items. WAC is one of the leading online e-commerce companies specializing in collectible merchandise. WAC was founded to tap into the multi-billion dollar collectible market place and has become one of the largest suppliers of this type of product.

In addition, Michael is the General Partner of Warp Nine Partners, LLC, a real estate partnership.

From September 1983 to February 2003, Michael was the President and Chief Executive Officer of eLabor.com, a privately held technology company that developed workforce management software both as licensed and hosted solutions. He spun off the project management division of eLabor which was acquired by Microsoft Corporation in 2002 and then sold the company to ADP in 2003.

via: Interneer
